intro: Sisyrinchium caratuvense, commonly known as the narrowleaf blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces delicate blue or violet flowers with prominent yellow centers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its small size and vibrant flowers make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
